sentences.en: Better have no war for a thousand days than slacken your vigilance for one day.
sentences.cn: 宁可千日不战,不可一日不备.

sentences.en: Inflationary pressures continued to slacken last month.
sentences.cn: 上个月，通货膨胀的压力继续减小。

sentences.en: Muscles stretch, slacken and relax during child-birth.
sentences.cn: 生孩子的时候，肌肉会拉抻、放松，然后松弛下来。

sentences.en: Redouble your efforts and not slacken off.
Simon allowed his pace to slacken.
Slacken ( off ) your speed as you approach the village.
sentences.cn: 接近村庄时要 放慢 速度.

sentences.en: Slacken your legs and slowly lie back.
sentences.cn: 放松双腿,慢慢向后躺下.

sentences.en: The demand for coal begins to slacken off in the spring.
sentences.cn: 煤的需求在春天开始减少.

sentences.en: The heavy rain showed no signs of slackening off.
This is the time to push rather than to slacken our efforts.
sentences.cn: 今后更应向前推进一步,决不能松懈我们的努力.

sentences.en: To slacken the tempo would mean falling behind.
sentences.cn: 放松步伐就意味着落后.

sentences.en: We're on the last lap, so don't slacken!
sentences.cn: 我们已处最后阶段, 可不要松劲 啊 !

sentences.en: We've been really busy, but things are starting to slacken off now.
sentences.cn: 近来我们的确很忙，不过现在情况开始有所缓解了。

sentences.en: We've been really busy, but things are starting to slacken off now.
sentences.cn: 我们忙极了, 不过现在事情开始减少了.

words.tran_cn: 松弛的；疏忽的；不流畅的
松弛地；懈怠地；不活跃地
放松；懈怠；使…松弛（slack的第三人称单数）
松劲，懈怠；变松弛；变缓慢

trans.tran_cn: 松弛, 放慢, 减弱, 减少, 减缓放慢
trans.tran_en: to gradually become slower, weaker, less active etc, or to make something do this

trans.tran_cn: （使）放慢，（使）放松、松懈、松弛，（使）减弱
